results.title: Atomisation
results.creator_credit: Bill Mason and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: Atomisation is defined as the breaking up of liquids into minute drops for efficient burning or economical spreading. Different methods of atomising liquids; scent spray; centrifugal spinning cup plus air blast; pressure jet. Slowed movement illustrations (150X) show how atomisation occurs. Main uses: agricultural and for burning liquid fuel. Various methods of qualitative and quantitative evaluation of spray patterns. Testing jet aircraft atomizers.

results.title: Australia's urban wildlife
results.creator_credit: Deborah Boerne, Janet Lane, ABC-TV (Australia) and Victoria. Dept. of Conservation
results.brief_description: As seen on the ABC’s “Behind The News” program, this video looks at the ways in which Australia’s native wildlife habitat has been altered by urban development. It also examines the ways in which students and teachers can learn about and value their local fauna. “Our hidden neighbours” is an introduction to native wildlife in urban areas and highlights the effect of urban development on wildlife. “Nocturnal visitors” looks at some of the native nocturnal wildlife found in urban areas. “The Feral menace” explores the problems that introduced animal species have caused for native wildlife. “Attracting wildlife” shows ways of attracting wildlife to your own backyard.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Deborah Boerne, Janet Lane, ABC-TV (Australia) and Victoria. Dept. of Conservation

results.title: Atomic structure and correlations within the Periodic Table
results.creator_credit: David G. Anderson, Andrew Patterson, Jr and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The first episode of this film looks at atomic structure and the Periodic Table, and the second episoe looks at correlations with the Periodic Table. Using a blackboard size Periodic Table from which individual elements can be removed or placed at will, this film illustrates a method of using the Periodic system to determine the electronic structure of atoms. Suitable for Upper-Secondary students.

results.title: Australia's New Faces 1969 Grand Final
results.creator_credit: Peter Faiman, Desmond Tester, John Proper and GTV9 Melbourne
results.brief_description: Out of 328 acts judged throughout 1969 are the 12 finalists. The winner will receive a $5,000 contract with the Nine Network. The winners - The Paul MacKay Sound; the judges - John Laws, Geoff Brook, Tom Miller, Pat London, Jim McKay. Hosted by Terry Dear and Frank Wilson, voice over by Pete Smith and sponsored by Kevin Dennis. Performing Contestants include Paul Mackay Sound and Mike McClellan.

results.title: Atomic juggernaut
results.creator_credit: Eugene Boyko, Tom Daly, Walford Hewitson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In India they call it Anushkati - the atomic juggernaut - a modern miracle brought from Canada to light an entire region. This film shows the strange procession made by the calandria, the heart of the nuclear reactor, hauled by huge diesel tractors from the seaport in India to the proposed site of the reactor, along a roadway specially prepared beforehand. Everywhere the juggernaut passed, ancient life stopped for a moment to witness the arrival of this new deity.

results.title: Atomic footprints
results.creator_credit: Pip Starr and Pip Starr Productions
results.brief_description:
The debate surrounding the production of nuclear energy goes back to the bombing of Hiroshima at the end of World War II. Since then, the proliferation of nuclear energy and weapons has been used as a deterrant, a bolstering of military power and, in the early 2000’s, as a solution to combat global warming.

With the Prime Minister John Howard’s comments regarding not ruling out atomic power stations, this documentary considers the implications to the environment, the people living on the land, our health and our future.

results.title: Aurore
results.brief_description:
Episode 2 of Series “Lagardere”.
Lagardere is in hiding in Spain with Aurore. He is still seeking to kill all those involved in that fateful night at Caylus 15 years ago. Each of his murders his signed with the famous ‘Nevers lunge’, a bloodied star on the forehead of the victim. Philippe has married Blanche in the hope of seizing her estate. He also keeps an army of informers whose mission it is to locate Lagardere and kidnap Aurore.

Credits: Producer, Robert Velin ; director, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; writers, Marcel Jullian, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; photography, Georges Barsky ; music, Jacques Loussier.
Cast: Jean Piat, Jacques Dufilho, Jean-Pierre Darras, Nadine Alari, Jacques Balutin, Claude Confortes, Marco Perrin.

results.title: Australia's Great Barrier Reef
results.creator_credit: Russell Kelley, Janine Hedley, David Reed, David Hannan, Television New Zealand Natural History Unit and David Hannan Productions
results.brief_description: Australia’s Great Barrier Reef is a visually vibrant documentary about the strange summer mating rituals that have resulted in the formation of one of the most stunning natural wonders of the world. A spectacular and sometimes surreal celebration of coral and reef society in general, focusing on the tactics used to perpetuate the species. Originally screened as “Sex of the Reef”. Winner of Golden Tripod Award for Wildlife and Nature at 25th Australian International Cinematographers Society Awards, and Gold Award Nature and Wildlife at the US International Film and Video Festival 1993.
